messages.content: In this election, you have the choice between a hard-working local campaigner, with a strong track record in the community in Grant Shapps, or Corbyn's candidate from Bedford. On Thursday 12th December there will be many names on your ballot paper, but Welwyn Hatfield remains a two-horse race.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Implement change to the Blue Badge scheme to benefit people with hidden disabilities.
Led the campaign to save Gosling Sports Hall from closure.
Working to keep Urgent Care Centre at the local hospital.
Secured compensation for commuters due to rail delays.

mentions.candidate: Grant Shapps will be returned as your MP
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Corbyn's candidate, who lives in Bedford
mentions.tacticalSituation: Welwyn Hatfield remains a two-horse race. It’s vital for an MP to have a clear track record.

issues.brexitEurope: Grant wants to get Brexit done so we can move on and concentrate on other issues like our future prosperity.
issues.health: Grant Shapps: Standing up for local healthcare.
issues.transport: Grant Shapps fights for rail users.

community.content: Grant and his team campaigning across all parts of Welwyn Hatfield.

leaflet.personalStatement: Grant Shapps has always made the welfare of Welwyn Hatfield his number one priority. If re-elected, he will continue to stand up for us in Parliament.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured compensation for rail delays, saved Gosling Sports Hall, fought for local healthcare and Blue Badge expansion.

images.caption: Grant Shapps talking to a constituent.
Leading the charge to save Gosling Sports Hall.
Grant personally fighting for Blue Badge expansion.

examples: Welwyn Hatfield remains a two-horse race.
Grant Shapps secured compensation for thousands of commuters due to rail delays.
Grant Shapps has always made the welfare of Welwyn Hatfield his number one priority.
Grant says, “When you live in the area you represent, you see all the same local issues yourself, so you are genuinely inspired to work tirelessly on getting them solved.
His track record includes standing up for local healthcare.
Campaigning across all parts of Welwyn Hatfield.
Grant wants to get Brexit done so we can move on and concentrate on other issues like our future prosperity.

personalStories.story: Grant personally fighting for Blue Badge expansion. One of Grant’s first acts as Secretary of State for Transport was to implement an overdue change to the Blue Badge scheme.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Grant has always made the welfare of Welwyn Hatfield his number one priority.

examples: Grant says, “When you live in the area you represent, you see all the same local issues yourself, so you are genuinely inspired to work tirelessly on getting them solved.
